meanings.definition: Stubborn or difficult to deal with
meanings.sent1: The oneriest cat refused to come inside during the rainstorm.
meanings.sent2: She can be the oneriest person to work with when she disagrees.
meanings.sent3: The oneriest squirrel in the park kept stealing all the birdseed.
meanings.sent4: Dealing with the oneriest customer felt like trying to move a mountain.
meanings.sent5: The oneriest puzzle in the box was missing a crucial piece.

meanings.definition: Showing a strong desire to argue or fight
meanings.sent1: The oneriest rooster in the yard always challenged the other animals.
meanings.sent2: He became the oneriest player on the team when he disagreed with the coach.
meanings.sent3: The oneriest clouds in the sky seemed to be arguing over who would rain first.
meanings.sent4: Her oneriest expression made it clear she was ready for a debate.
meanings.sent5: The oneriest dog at the park barked at every passerby.

meanings.sent1: The oneriest math problem in the homework assignment took hours to solve.
meanings.sent2: It was the oneriest decision she had to make in her entire career.
meanings.sent3: The oneriest trail in the forest led to the most beautiful view.
meanings.sent4: Facing the oneriest obstacle in his path, he refused to give up.
meanings.sent5: The oneriest level of the game required precise timing and strategy.
